intro: Auriculardisia chiriquiana, commonly known as the Chiriquí auricula, is a flowering plant native to Central America. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually white or pale blue, attracting various pollinators.
